intro: Astragalus goldmanii, commonly known as Goldman's milkvetch, is a perennial herb native to the western United States. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. It has a deep root system that helps it survive in nutrient-poor soils. Astragalus goldmanii is also valued for its ecological role in supporting pollinators and stabilizing soil in its native range.
